Job description

  • 15 Month Fixed Term Contract

Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre (MCEC) is Melbourne’s destination for big ideas and inspirational events. Hosting more than 1000 events each year, we’re internationally renowned for our incredible range of spaces, innovative design and jaw-dropping food. Our people are at the heart of who we are and what we do. That’s why at MCEC, we do more than create remarkable events. The position


A terrific role for a motivated high achiever, as our Financial Controller you will…


  • Oversee the day to day functions of the Finance team, ensuring they operate in an efficient and collaborative manner across the organisation in the areas of reporting, accounts receivable, accounts payable and fixed assets. Team of six with three direct reports

Are you interested in creating a career doing what you are meant to do? Do you want to sharpen and supercharge your coaching skills? Then join YB12 Coach, the company that delivers premium, ICF credentialed life coach and corporate coach training.

Coaching works because the focus is on the present. Your clients simply set goals and go about accomplishing them.

What Can YB12 Coach Do for You?

1. Provides you with the perfect opportunity to take the right steps to make coaching your full-time career.

2. Presents the most effective tools and support you need to create a 6-figure business. The tools and support include:

  • \xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 access to coaching materials and resources on the company’s Back Office,
  • \xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 one-on-one meetings with your Master Coach,

  • \xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 coach training modules,
  • \xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 regular\xa0 team training, and more.

5. Guides you in mastering a system that will inspire your clients to chase you, not the other way around.

\xa0

YB12 Coach Makes Running Your Own Coaching Business a Breeze
  • You will receive extensive training specifically focused on coaching your clients to have their finest year ever.

  • You will get superlative support that enables you to find as many clients as you want to work with.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0\xa0

Since 90% of businesses are not\xa0satisfied with their ongoing training programs, the potential for finding clients is huge. Our proven deliverables include one-on-one coaching programs as well as an assortment of corporate workshops.

Job description

Civica has a global Glassdoor rating of 4.2. Check us out!


About Us\xa0

Civica builds software and provides IT and digital transformation services to support some of the most important organisations in our communities; like schools, libraries, local councils and State agencies. We work with some of the largest health fund providers bringing their services into the digital age. We support our customers with cloud-based services. Our products are market leaders, some of them are globally renowned. Civica in ANZ is part of Civica Group, a UK headquartered fast-growing global software enterprise, gaining increased profile in the local market.


Our team is proud to work within the sectors we do, where we make a real difference, contributing to the growth of the communities that we live in and accelerating the digital transformation of the public sector and associated markets. Want to join us and help continue our mission?


About The Role

This is an exciting opportunity to join our Managed Services business unit based in Melbourne & be a key member of our transformation programme team. You will develop and implement solutions for a wide range of business transformation projects & use your creativity and operation knowledge to deliver business solutions. Focusing across front of house and back of house, you will contribute to both developing and delivering the Target Operating Model. .

\xa0

Responsibilities

  • Analyse service and performance data to identify areas where transformation is required
  • Work with the wider team to translate solution designs into transformation projects and support the delivery of these
  • Continued development and improvement of the Target Operating Model, capturing best practice within Civica & innovating to improve
  • Ensure that changes introduced through transformation are effectively handed over to BAU at the close of projects and supporting the change management process to deliver this outcome


About You

We are looking for an out of the box thinker with proven track record of business improvements. You will be solutions focused, highly analytical and prepared to challenge the status quo. You will also have:

  • Excellent and proven ability to influence stakeholders and build strong relationships
  • A self-started with an organised approach to handling multiple task
  • Ability to produce high quality written and statistical work under pressure to tight deadlines


Your Benefits

At Civica we believe our people are our biggest asset and we pride ourselves on cultivating a supportive and modern working environment; whilst providing you with the tools you need to get the job done. We will offer what you would expect in today’s modern work environments:

  • Join a growing and successful business
  • Genuine career development
  • Flexible working conditions


What Next?

Do we sound like a good match? If so then we would love to hear from you! Please include a cover letter\xa0outlining how your experience, aspirations and values are a match, along with your resume and we will take it from there.

836892446:
[

Code Search - UI Designer

Company Name Elastic Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 42 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. Elastic is the leading software provider for making structured and unstructured data usable in real time for search, logging, security and analytics use cases. Since its initial release in 2012, Elastic's products have achieved more than 100 million cumulative downloads. Today thousands of organizations like Cisco, eBay, Dell, Goldman Sachs, Groupon, HP, Microsoft, Netflix, NY Times, Uber, Verizon, Yelp, and Wikipedia use the Elastic Stack, X-Pack, and Elastic Cloud to power critical systems that drive new revenue opportunities and massive cost savings. We believe that diversity drives our vibe. We unite Elasticians across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.

We recently joined forces with a new team, Elastic Code Search and we are now looking to bring on board an experienced UI Designer to join our globally distributed team.

What is Elastic Code Search?

Elastic Code Search is a IDE-like semantic code search solution built on top of the Elastic Stack. It helps development teams to search, navigate and collaborate on large code bases more efficiently. Known previously as insight.io, the product has been used and loved by tens of thousands of developers and received 5 star review on chrome store. You will be a founding member of Elastic Code Search team and a shaper of the Elastic Code Search product.

What You'll Be Doing

In this role, you will spearhead the product design initiatives for Elastic Code Search. We will look to you for expertise related to product designs, prototypes and UX flows for the Code Search / UI team. You will maintain our Sketch library and keep parity once your designs are coded, provide design recommendations and support through code review for the team, and supply iconography and illustration work as needed in your design. All while doing so with the full support of a leadership team who knows the importance of design.

You will be given the freedom and autonomy to create beautiful work in an environment of your choice, working fully remotely with an international team of world-class Engineers and Designers. If you are looking for an opportunity to make a huge impact on the inception and evolution of Elastic Code Search while also being a part of shaping the future of how Product Design works at Elastic, this could be your dream job! This requires not only a level of creativity and ingenuity but also the hunger and grit to roll your sleeves up and build something extraordinary.

If this sounds like you, we’d love to talk.

What You've Done
  • 5+ years of design experience working on complicated web applications or SaaS products.
  • Experience with Sketch, specifically in the context of developing a design system.
  • Facility with thinking in terms of systems, marked by an ability to make design decisions that scale and result in reusable patterns, palettes, and components.
  • Considers how low-level design decisions affect the big picture and the future evolution of the UX.
  • A positive attitude and a matching commitment to innovate.


Bonus Skills
  • Familiarity with JS frameworks like React or Angular.
  • Experience building responsive and accessible designs.
  • Experience in designing a developer facing product.
  • Previous coding experience and experience with tools like IDE or GitHub.


Additional Information
  • Deeply competitive pay and Stock options
  • An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life
  • Passionate people building great products
  • Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.
  • Distributed-first company with employees all over the world, some even fly south for the winter :)


Target Locations: Beijing, China; London, United Kingdom; Barcelona, Spain; Toronto, Canada; Vancouver, Canada; New York City, NY; Austin, TX; Denver, CO; Portland, OR; Seattle, WA; Atlanta, GA

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

  • Recognition of prior service in the public sector for the purposes of Long Service Leave

About the Role

The Senior Manager Health plays a critical role in leading the Health Branch within the Supported Recovery Division. This role will influence and oversee all areas of the Health Provider Management System, with the ultimate aim of improved recovery and health outcomes for our clients.

As the Senior Manager you will work with primary care networks to optimise and expand the range of rehabilitation pathways for TAC clients and support, mobilise and implement the TAC’s strategic objectives. You will be responsible for leading innovation and continuous improvement projects with the aim of optimising the TAC’s ability to get clients lives back on track. This will also include the leadership and development of a high performing management team and building and maintaining strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders.


You will have the opportunity to work at a strategic level within a highly engaged and collaborative team, while enjoying a significant sense of achievement in making a difference to the lives of those affected by transport accidents.


About You

To be successful in this role, you will ideally possess the following skills and attributes:

  • Demonstrated experience utilising operational and strategic thinking and implementing business improvement initiatives
  • Experience in establishing and cultivating partnerships, within the health and/or health insurance sectors
  • Experience negotiating and influencing at senior levels across multiple internal and external stakeholder groups
  • Significant demonstrated leadership experience


\xa0Our Values

  • We value life
  • We make every conversation count
  • We will find a better way, today
  • We make the complicated simple


Diversity and Inclusion

The TAC promotes a workplace that actively seeks to include, welcome and value unique contributions of all people and is committed to diversity and social inclusion in its employment practices. As Victoria’s Commission for transport accident treatment and services, we strongly encourage people with a disability to apply for our roles. People from indigenous, culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds are also encouraged to apply.


How to Apply

Click APPLY\xa0or contact Kaitlin Travers on (03) 5225 6906 for further information.Applications for this role will be accepted up until 17th September 2018 at 12.00pm. \xa0

Job description

Sales Professional


Company Overview


Are you passionate about education and technology? Do you want a job that can provide you with the perfect work-life balance? If you answered yes to any of the above, then we might be the perfect fit for you!


We're a fast-growing Australian education technology company that is building a global web app for K-12 schools worldwide. Our product, Schoolbox, is a self- or cloud-hosted community portal, intranet and learning management system that is now being sold in four countries.


At Alaress Pty. Ltd., we know that life isn't all work and no play, which is why our company culture focuses on collaboration and teamwork above all else! Our team shares a common vision: to create amazing software that has a positive impact on education and schools around the world. Though the company is rapidly expanding, we still maintain a startup culture and outlook. Join our team and be a party of this unique community!


About the Role

Enjoy being part of an amazing Sales and Marketing team that support a product that is making a real difference in the lives of students and educators.


Your role will focus on engaging prospective customers and opportunities created by a dedicated marketing team and specific outbound campaigns. Converting these schools into customers will be your challenge, creating an outstanding customer experience so they are a customer for life should be your aspiration.


Whilst this is a sales role, we believe that helping you grow to become a product expert who can consult instead of “sell”, results in a far more engaging sales process and creates powerful customer advocacy.


We will provide you with a deep and on-going training program coupled with a detailed onboarding process to give you the tools for greatest success. Added to this will be your hunger for self-learning which will help you become a subject matter expert.


If you are a passionate and experienced relationship-builder within the technology industry, education, software, sales or ICT background, read on... this may be your next career opportunity.


The talented hard working 'Customer Experience' enjoy high levels of customer satisfaction, high conversion rates for new customer acquisition and this role will allow you to cultivate and expand relationships with long-standing and new Schoolbox customers.


Here's what you need to succeed


  • Technical background, minimum 2 years software technology experience in sales, preferably education industry.

  • Strong demonstration and public speaking skills

  • Passionate in closing new business sales through applying a consultative selling approach.

  • Operationally disciplined, well organised, and excellent time management.

  • Ability to confidently interact at an executive level within a school environment, and demonstrate the product to variety of stakeholders.

  • Flexibility to travel, including valid, unrestricted passport and driver's license.

  • Experience with CRM systems e.g. Salesforce.


You will enjoy


  • Flexible working environment, hours and some work from home options.

  • Professional development opportunities including a self improvement annual budget.

  • Profit share in the company's success.

  • Potential for career progression

  • Working in a great culture where people enjoy their job, the work they do and the software they create.

  • Being part of a high-tech company that is experiencing rapid growth based on a market leading product.

  • Our fantastic customers and the great relationships we have with them.


Join a team and company who are supporting each other to reach their full potential. This is your opportunity to be a part of something much bigger. We are forging an Australian tech legacy and need your skills, attitude and hard work to ensure our company is a global success.


Please send your cover letter detailing why you are the right person, your salary level expectation for this position and your r\xe9sum\xe9 to careers@alaress.com.au.

Critical Care Registered Nurse - Intensive Care Unit

Company Name Epworth Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 9 views

Job description

  • Multiple opportunities for experienced Critical Care Nurses to join a great team at Epworth Freemasons
  • General Intensive Care Unit
  • Located in Melbourne, clsoe to CBD and public transport

Epworth Freemasons

Located in East Melbourne, close to public transport and the CBD, Epworth Freemasons provides a range of world-class health services. As one of Victoria's leading maternity hospitals, Epworth Freemasons specialises in women’s and men’s health services including breast and gynaecological surgery, endoscopy and urology. Epworth Freemasons also offers comprehensive cancer care, and a full range of surgical services, including robotic assisted surgery, orthopaedics and ICU care.

Epworth Freemasons has recently upgraded and expanded its operating theatres and admissions facilities, along with major refurbishments of patient rooms and building infrastructure. Epworth Freemasons is about to undertake a major redevelopment project which will create additional state-of-the-art theatres, expanded oncology services and extensive on-site car parking for staff and doctors.

The Role

We are seeking and experience Critical Care Registered Nurse to join our dynamic and experienced Intensive Care Unit team. The Unit is a 8-13 bed, combined ICU/HDU/telemetry unit treating a wide range of patients with a variety of critical illnesses. We have 24 hour on site medical staff, a dedicated educator and a close knit, experienced nursing team making Epworth Freemasons ICU a great place to work.

Skills & Experience

Successful candidates will possess-
  • Experience in an ICU setting, able to demonstrate superior critical care nursing skills
  • Post Graduate qualifications in Critical/Intensive Care Nursing (preferred)
  • Well developed interpersonal and communication skills
  • A commitment to ensuring a high level of patient care and positive patient outcomes

Epworth Freemasons

The Epworth Freemasons Hospital provides a world-class health service. As one of Victoria's leading maternity hospitals, Epworth Freemasons specialises in women’s health services including obstetrics, gynaecological and breast surgery. Epworth Freemasons also provides comprehensive cancer care, along with a full range of surgical services, including the latest robotic assisted surgery, orthopaedics and ICU care.

It is an exciting time to join Epworth Freemasons, having only recently been upgraded we have commenced a major redevelopment that will represent a generational change for our Clarendon Street hospital with construction underway to provide more consulting suites, operating theatres and improvements to patient amenity.

We are constructing a 12-level tower and buildings that will link to create significant onsite consulting opportunities for specialists, additional state-of-the-art theatres, expanded oncology services and extensive underground on-site car parking. We are also upgrading our maternity service facilities at our Victoria Parade campus in 2018.

About Epworth

Epworth HealthCare is a world-class, not-for-profit, private health care group dedicated to providing the best possible outcomes for our patients by providing the best possible care. Across our eight locations patients and staff have access to state-of-the-art diagnostic, surgical and procedural technology, world-class theatres and equipment and benefit from the extensive teaching and research occurring at Epworth every day.

The Epworth Difference is defined by our unique culture and dedication to giving outstanding patient care. From the way we recognise and reward our staff to our attitude toward the patient experience, Epworth is for those with the ambition to get better, give the best possible care and lead their field.

Epworth is a great choice for staff who want to be part of a cutting-edge, fast paced and progressive environment.

Job description

Summary

Amazing opportunity to commence your legal career as a Junior Legal Assistant in our structured program. Develop your legal knowledge and skills with ongoing support from your team.

Overview

The Firm
Since the day Maurice Blackburn opened our doors nearly a hundred years ago, we’ve been in the business of helping people; fighting to make a genuine difference to people’s lives. We exist to help everyday Australians use the law to fight back against unfair treatment. Our passion for righting wrongs is at the heart of everything we do. This is why we’ve grown to become Australia’s leading social justice law firm. After all, we believe wholeheartedly in what we do.

The Program
The Victorian Junior Legal Assistant Program has been developed to attract tertiary qualified graduates who are keen to move into the legal arena and commence careers as Legal Assistants. Our program provides a broad range of training designed to familiarise you with all aspects of plaintiff law. The Victorian program consists of 2 x 6 month rotations and provides you with the opportunity to develop a thorough understanding of two practice areas. The program encourages active participation and contribution, enabling you to be rewarded with excellent training opportunities, and to provide you with a real sense of accomplishment.

Skills & Experience We’re Looking For
  • A genuine interest in plaintiff law and knowledge of our areas of practice;
  • An understanding of our history and appreciation of our values;
  • Completion of, or working towards, a tertiary qualification such as the Advanced Diploma of Business/Legal Practice, Bachelor of Business or similar;
  • Superior communication skills (both verbal and written);
  • Ability to apply time management and organisational skills;
  • Demonstrated initiative and adaptability; and
  • Client service and team focus.

Please note applications from law students/graduates will not be accepted.

Availability
Our program is offered on a 12 month full time contract. All applicants must be available full time for the duration of the program.

Offer day: Friday 26 October 2018
Program commencement: Monday 4 February 2019

Work with people who are truly passionate about the work we do and the impact we have on the community. From the kind of people who work here, to the kind of cases we take on, these values have run deeply throughout our organisation for almost a century.

Job description

  • This is a great opportunity to take your Administration or Office Management career to teh next level
  • Kilmore location


Following a period of significant growth, we are currently looking to identify an efficient and driven Office Manager to lead our Real Estate Sales Support Team which is part of the Ruralco Property network.

\xa0

About the role:

Reporting to the Real Estate Business Manager, you will take ownership for developing a centre of excellence responsible for providing support to our growing real estate sales team (including Ruralco Property and the PRH businesses), including best in class support across settlements, listings, trust accounting and communications. Leading and managing an experienced team of administrators located throughout our Vic and NSW branch locations. Skilled at attracting and retaining employees who are aligned to our values and continually looking for ways to upskill and develop our existing team, you will ensure that the team is recognized internally for providing a consistent high level of sales support, working collaboratively across all teams and locations. There is a strong focus on ensuring compliance including effectively managing a central register of property and real estate licenses together with maintaining high levels of accuracy in data integrity, trust accounting processes and customer file maintenance. You will work with management to seek feedback and with a focus on continuous improvement you will ensure that the sales support team is recognized as the best provider of support enabling the sales team to achieve their targets and goals.

\xa0

About you:

To be successful you must demonstrate proven sales administration and/or team\xa0leadership experience which may come from a property/real estate, agribusiness banking, financial services or insurance background and with experience leading a change process. Your success developing high performing teams and driving accountability for delivery of consistent and efficient sales support will be highly regarded. With relevant tertiary qualifications in Commerce, Business or Marketing, you will be a clear communicator, and negotiator with the ability to influence and work well with a variety of people to drive business outcomes.

\xa0

This role involves occasional regional travel.

\xa0

Ruralco, including its subsidiaries, is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. At Ruralco we believe that creating a diverse workforce will provide the best talent to achieve our strategy of being the leading Australian Agribusiness and Employer of Choice in our sector.

We value integrity, accountability, loyalty, leadership, common sense and aiming high in all that we do.

\xa0

Interested?

\xa0

To join this diverse business offering the opportunity to develop and progress your career alongside like-minded people in a supportive environment, just click on the APPLY button below. To find out more about the Ruralco Group go to www.ruralco.com.au or click on the below and follow us on LinkedIn:

\xa0

We’re here for Australian Farmers.

837148575:
[

Travel Consultant - Captain's Choice

Company Name APT Travel Group Company Location Level 4, 1230 Nepean Highway , Cheltenham, VIC 3192, AU

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 63 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

A snapshot of us & the role:

Headquartered in Cheltenham, APT Travel Group has recently celebrated its 91st birthday and we are showing no signs of slowing down. Boasting an extensive travel portfolio, brands operating under our umbrella include APT, Travelmarvel, Captain’s Choice and Botanica, we are Australia’s largest locally owned tour company and most awarded after all!

Representing the elite Captain's Choice brand, you will join the Guest Relations team as a Travel Consultant with expertise in luxury travel, managing end to end reservations. Working in a small team environment you will be responsible for owning each reservation you take - from creating the booking within the system, to arranging the flights and handling special requests to everything in between! You will be acting as a personal travel consultant to each of our valued passengers and enjoy the luxury of not being required to work to sales targets, to allow yourself sufficient time to really give 110% to each booking, personalising the experience for the customer and providing faultless delivery of each and every reservation.

We currently have two positions within the team. Whether you are a recent graduate looking to break into the travel industry and grow your expertise in luxury travel or an experienced travel consultant, this could be your next move!

\xa0

\xa0

Some of the typical responsibilities of the role are:

  • Selling Captain's Choice exciting range of products
  • Managing each individual reservation from beginning to end
  • Managing inbound phone calls and emails
  • Providing exceptional customer service
  • Converting enquires to bookings
  • General administration

*It’s important to note that you’ll work on a rotating roster with a Saturday shift (9am-2pm) every 4-5 weeks.


What type of skills, background and qualifications would this role require?

We are ideally looking for someone with a passion for luxury travel and the industry as a whole and are open to both applicants with experience within the industry and fresh graduates alike.

Travel Consultants that do well are able to demonstrate exceptional customer service skills, are enthusiastic, enjoy working as part of a team and display strong attention to detail. They exhibit a can do attitude and thrive in a fast paced environment. Strong time management skills and efficiency is a must in this role, where you will be taking on average 15-20 calls per day and managing approximately 30 email enquiries. System training will be provided but air knowledge (such as flight carriers and airline codes) would be advantageous.

\xa0

\xa0In return for your hard work and commitment we provide the following benefits:

  • Amazing staff travel discounts on APT and Travelmarvel products.
  • Join a close knit and supportive team.
  • Participate in regular team building initiatives and games.
  • Social club and wellness program.
  • Want to feel good and do some good in community? Then you can with your 2 annual volunteer days.

\xa0

If you have recently completed a course in travel and are looking to take the next step in your career or are an experienced travel consultant, why wait? Apply today!

 Civil Construction Manager - Mining & Earthworks

Report directly to the GM, managing PM, Senior PE and Superintendent
Be the face of the business, win projects, lead the construction teams

The Company

Well established almost 30 years within Mining and Earthworks industry.
This role will be based in Yallourn a relocation package will be on offer if needed.
With an excellent safety record and Earthworks contracts till 2052 they are in a very stable position.

Civil Construction Manager build and develop business, oversee end to end construction.

Speech Pathologist

Company Name Link Health and Community Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 18 views

Job description

Link Health and Community (Link HC) supports people in our community through the provision of General Practice, Dental, Allied Health, Counselling, Volunteer, health promotion services and more recently as the Early Childhood Early Intervention (ECEI) Community Partner of the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS) for Inner and Outer East Metropolitan and Inner Gippsland.\xa0


Link Health & Community are seeking an experienced Speech Pathologist to commence in September. You will exceptional client care under the CHSP and Community Health Programs. \xa0 The Speech Pathologist works in a multi-disciplinary team and \xa0provides both centre and home-based care.


Tasks and Responsibilities

  • Experience providing assessment and intervention mechanisms in line with Commonwealth Home Support Programme and Community Health funding.
  • Ability to collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team to ensure best outcomes for service users.
  • Excellent communicator, with ability to apply health literacy principles.
  • Ability to work collaboratively with others, including employees, clients, their families and carers and people from diverse backgrounds.
  • Intermediate level with e-technology (iPad) and produce accurate written documents, spread sheets and notes.

Skills and Experience

  • Minimum tertiary qualification in Bachelor of Speech Pathology (or equivalent)
  • Current SPA Registration
  • Demonstrated 4 years’ clinical experience

Mandatory:

  • Police Check, both National and where applicable International
  • Current Working with Children Check
  • Professional Association Registration
  • A Current Drivers Licence

Link HC is child safe and equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We encourage all suitable applicants to apply. Applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from a culturally diverse background and people with a lived experience of disability are encouraged to apply. Applicants must be eligible to work in Australia.

Visit http://www.linkhc.org.au/get-involved/careers/ to view the Position Description.

To apply please submit your CV along with a cover letter outlining your experience.
